data.text:
6 - 9 February, 2017

Introduction

The “Workshop on Heavy Quark Physics” is being organized by National Centre for Physics (NCP), Islamabad on February 6-9, 2017.

This first workshop on Heavy Quark Physics is dedicated to Professor Riazuddin (Late), first Director General, National Centre for Physics, Islamabad. It will mainly focus on heavy quark flavor physics. The field of heavy quark flavor physics is of topical interest due to its discovery potential at the LHCb and B-factories like Belle, Babar, etc.

Introduction

Flavor Physics and CP violation (A. Ali)

Theory of Hadronic B Decays (Cai-Dian Lu)

Light-Cone Distribution Amplitudes (A. Parkhomenko)

B-meson decays in Precision Era (M. Misiak)

Theory of Multi-quarks Physics (L. Maiani)

Hadronic Decays of Heavy Baryons (Fayyazuddin)

Searches for Physics beyond the SM in b decays. And, Exotic Tetraquark and Pentaquark States (S. Stone)

Multibody decays of b Mesons (Ying Li & W. Wang)

Ultra-relativistic heavy ion collisions and the quark-gluon plasma (J.P. Blaizot)

The research interest in heavy quark physics has grown progressively over the last few years in Pakistan and presently we have a sizable research community working at NCP and different universities of Pakistan. The purpose of this workshop is to encourage young Pakistani researchers and to facilitate them in building international collaborations. In this context, we plan to have 3/4 lectures on each of these topics.

Participation

Active post graduate students, post-doctoral researchers, faculty and research scientists who have also published research work in recognized international journals, will be encouraged to participate (oral or poster presentation). Local hospitality will be provided to the participants. As a rule, travel expenses of the participants should be borne by their home institutes. However, partial travel assistance may be provided to selected local participants residing outside Islamabad.

How to apply

Application Form can be accessed here. Application Form should be submitted on or before January 15, 2017. Selection will be made by Technical Committee of workshop. Selected applicants will be required to pay registration fee (employed person: Rs. 2000/- students: Rs. 1500/-).
